        p1 and p2 are the names of the players. p keeps track of who the current player is.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method introduces the game, asks the users for their names, and then calls playGame() to play a Tic Tac Toe Game.
        Parameters:
        args - an array of Strings which we ignore It returns nothing.

      • playGame

        public static void playGame()
        playGame() This method allows the player to keep playing the game, by calling playOneMove(), until a victor is decided. Then it congraluates the winner. It takes no input. It returns nothing.

      • printBoard

        public static void printBoard()
        printBoard() This method prints out the current state of the Tic Tac Toe board. It takes no input. It returns nothing.

      • gameOver

        public static boolean gameOver()
        gameOver() This method checks to see if a player has won the game yet.
        Returns:
        is true if a player has won the game, and false if a player has not.

      • horizontalSearch

        public static boolean horizontalSearch(int i,
                                       int j,
                                       java.lang.String a)
        horizontalSearch(i,j,a) This method searches for wins on the board in the horizontal direction.
        Parameters:
        i - and
        j - are the starting coordinates.
        a - is an "X" or an "O", keeping track of what letters to check for.
        Returns:
        is a boolean. If true, a win has been found. If false, no win has been found.

      • verticalSearch

        public static boolean verticalSearch(int i,
                                     int j,
                                     java.lang.String a)
        verticalSearch(i,j,a) This method searches for wins on the board in the vertical direction.
        Parameters:
        i - and
        j - are the starting coordinates.
        a - is an "X" or an "O", keeping track of what letters to check for.
        Returns:
        is a boolean. If true, a win has been found. If false, no win has been found.

      • diagonalSearch

        public static boolean diagonalSearch(int i,
                                     int j,
                                     java.lang.String a)
        diagonalSearch(i,j,a) This method searches for wins on the board in the diagonal direction.
        Parameters:
        i - and
        j - are the starting coordinates.
        a - is an "X" or an "O", keeping track of what letters to check for.
        Returns:
        is a boolean. If true, a win has been found. If false, no win has been found.

      • playOneMove

        public static boolean playOneMove()
        playOneMove() This method allows the user to play one move of the game, by entering in the coordinates of the square they wish to occupy. It checks to see whether the game has been won yet. It takes no input.
        Returns:
        is a boolean, true if a player has won the game and false if a player has not yet won the game.

      • getCoordinates

        public static void getCoordinates()
        getCoordinates() This method reads the coordinates the user has entered, along with readSecondInput(). It takes no input. It returns nothing.

      • readSecondInput

        public static boolean readSecondInput()
        readSecondInput() This method reads in the second coordinate number the user enters and checks to ensure the input is valid. It takes no input.
        Returns:
        is a boolean, true if the input is valid and false if it isn't.
